news_header: HSBC is restructuring its operations into eastern and western markets to enhance efficiency and respond to geopolitical tensions, with changes effective from 2025.
news_text: HSBC's new CEO, Georges Elhedery, has announced a significant restructuring of the bank, dividing its operations into eastern and western markets to streamline processes and reduce costs amidst rising geopolitical tensions. The bank will simplify its structure into four main units, merging its commercial and institutional banking divisions, with changes set to take effect in 2025. Additionally, HSBC appointed its first female finance chief, Ms. Kaur, who has been with the bank for over a decade. The new structure aims to create a more agile organization, focusing on strategic priorities and enhancing market share in key areas, particularly in wealth management and the Middle East.
